text: Heiner Backhaus (born 4 February 1982) is a German football manager former professional player who manages Rot-Weiß Koblenz. As a player, he was a journeyman who played as a defensive midfielder. ==Playing career== Born in Witten, West Germany, Backhaus made his professional debut with Hannover 96 on 12 August 2001, against SpVgg Unterhaching, on the 61st minute replacing Nebojša Krupniković. He played for Rot-Weiss Essen, 1. FC Union Berlin, Borussia Mönchengladbach, DSC Arminia Bielefeld and Kickers Offenbach in Germany, and AEK Larnaca in Cyprus.„Ich wollte die Welt entdecken“ 11freunde.de He played for Valletta from summer 2007 but left the club at the end of the season, after the championship success to join Kitchee SC of Hong Kong. ==Honours== Valletta * Maltese Premier League: 2007–08 ==References== ==Other websites== * * Category:1982 births Category:Living people Category:Association football midfielders Category:German footballers Category:Arminia Bielefeld players Category:German football managers Category:SG Sonnenhof Großaspach managers
title: Heiner Backhaus
